title.narrative: INCREASED CAPACITY OF DUTY BEARERS TO USE RESEARCH AND BUDGET ANALYSIS

description.narrative: Duty-bearers at national and subnational levels have increased capacity to use research and budget analysis to plan efficient integrated programmes for multi-dimensionally deprived children., which contributes to Child Poverty / Public Finance For Children, Cross-Sectoral Monitoring, Data And Situation Analyses, Social Protection. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2023 the poorest children in Rwanda benefit from a strengthened and adequately-resourced integrated social protection system

participating-org.narrative: MINISTRY OF FINANCE AND ECONOMIC PLANNING MINECOFIN
NATIONAL INSTITUTE OF STATISTICS OF RWANDA NISR

sector.narrative: Administrative data, registers and non-MICS household surveys and censuses
Child poverty measurement: support to routine national measurement of monetary and multidimensional child poverty
PF4C: Budget transparency, accountability and participation
PF4C: Improving public expenditure effectiveness / efficiency
Public finance management in social protection
Social protection and welfare services policy, planning and administration
Stimulating demand for and capacity to use data

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Duty-bearers at national and subnational levels have increased capacity to use research and budget analysis to plan efficient integrated programmes for multi-dimensionally deprived children.

description.narrative: Data on nationally owned multidimensional and monetary child poverty lines were capitalized on and steps were taken to ensure continued measuring of child-related indicators and capacity building on child-focused national budget analysis and budget transparency | Status:On-track | As-of Date:07/08/2020

Child poverty is routinely measured and reported by the government
